attributes.action: Legalise the production, sale and use of cannabis.
attributes.background:
Legalising cannabis could bring in £900m in taxes every year, save £400m on policing cannabis and create over 10,000 new jobs.

A substance that is safer than alcohol, and has many uses. It is believed to have been used by humans for over 4000 years, being made illegal in the UK in 1925.

rejection.details:
The existing petition on legalising cannabis is still open for new signatures until 21 January 2016 so we cannot accept a duplicate. It is still possible for MPs to seek further debates or action on this issue if they wish to do so.

The petition is here:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/104349
